intro: Silene nevskii, commonly known as the Nevskii's campion, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Silene nevskii is known for its delicate, hairy stems and leaves, which help it survive in harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
